  20FFnets = {
  21    'normal': NDNnetworks.FFnetwork,
  22    'add': NDNnetworks.FFnetwork,  # just controls how inputs are concatenated
  23    'mult': NDNnetworks.FFnetwork, # just controls how inputs are concatenated
  24    'scaffold': NDNnetworks.ScaffoldNetwork, # forward concatenates all layers (default: convolutional)
  25    'scaffold3d': NDNnetworks.ScaffoldNetwork3d, # forward concatenates all layers (default: convolutional)
  26    'readout': NDNnetworks.ReadoutNetwork
  27}
  28
  29class NDN(nn.Module):
  30    """
  31    Initializes an instance of the NDN (Neural Deep Network) class.
  32
  33    Args:
  34        ffnet_list (list): A list of FFnetwork objects. If None, a single ffnet specified by layer_list will be used.
  35        layer_list (list): A list specifying the layers of the FFnetwork. Only used if ffnet_list is None.
  36        external_modules (list): A list of external modules to be used in the FFnetwork.
  37        loss_type (str): The type of loss function to be used. Default is 'poisson'.
  38        ffnet_out (int or list): The index(es) of the output layer(s) of the FFnetwork(s). If None, the last layer will be used.
  39        optimizer_params (dict): Parameters for the optimizer. If None, default parameters will be used.
  40        model_name (str): The name of the model. If None, a default name will be assigned.
  41        seed (int): The random seed to be used for reproducibility.
  42        working_dir (str): The directory to save checkpoints and other files.
  43
  44    Returns:
  45        None
  46    """
  47    
  48    def __init__(self,
  49        ffnet_list = None,
  50        layer_list = None,  # can just import layer list if consisting of single ffnetwork (simple ffnet)
  51        external_modules = None,
  52        loss_type = 'poisson', 
  53        ffnet_out = None,
  54        optimizer_params = None,
  55        model_name=None,
  56        seed=None,
  57        working_dir='./checkpoints'):
  58
  59        super().__init__()
  60
  61        # save the ffnet_list for serialization purposes
  62        from copy import deepcopy
  63        self.loss_type = loss_type
  64        self.ffnet_out = ffnet_out
  65        
  66        self.seed = seed
  67        if seed is not None:
  68            # set flags / seeds    
  69            np.random.seed(seed)
  70            torch.manual_seed(seed)
  71            torch.cuda.manual_seed(seed)
  72
  73        if ffnet_list is None:
  74            # then must be a single ffnet specified by layer_list
  75            assert layer_list is not None, "NDN: must specify either ffnet_list or layer_list."
  76            from .networks import FFnetwork
  77            ffnet_list = [FFnetwork.ffnet_dict(layer_list=layer_list)]
  78        else:
  79            assert layer_list is None, "NDN: cannot specify ffnet_list and layer_list at same time."
  80        assert type(ffnet_list) is list, 'FFnetwork list in NDN constructor must be a list.'
  81        self.ffnet_list = deepcopy(ffnet_list)
  82 
  83        if (ffnet_out is None) or (ffnet_out == -1):
  84            ffnet_out = len(ffnet_list)-1
  85
  86        self.working_dir = working_dir
  87
  88        # Configure loss
  89        if isinstance(loss_type, str):
  90            self.loss_type = loss_type
  91            if loss_type == 'poisson' or loss_type == 'poissonT':
  92                self.loss_module = plosses.PoissonLoss_datafilter()  # defined below, but could be in own Losses.py
  93            elif loss_type in ['simple', 'poissonS']:
  94                self.loss_module = plosses.SimplePoissonLoss()
  95            elif loss_type in ['gaussian', 'mse']:
  96                self.loss_module = glosses.MseLoss_datafilter()
  97            elif loss_type in ['rmse']:
  98                self.loss_module = rlosses.RmseLoss()
  99            else:
 100                print('Invalid loss function.')
 101                self.loss_module = None
 102        else: # assume passed in loss function directly
 103            self.loss_type = 'custom'
 104            self.loss_module = loss_type
 105
 106        # module can also be called as a function (since it has a forward)
 107        self.loss = self.loss_module
 108        self.val_loss = self.loss_module
 109        self.trainer = None  # to stash last trainer used in fitting
 110        self.block_sample = False  # if need time-contiguous blocks
 111
 112        # Assemble FFnetworks from if passed in network-list -- else can embed model
 113        networks = self.assemble_ffnetworks(ffnet_list, external_modules)
 114        
 115        # Check and record output of network
 116        if not isinstance(ffnet_out, list):
 117            ffnet_out = [ffnet_out]
 118        
 119        for ii in range(len(ffnet_out)):
 120            if ffnet_out[ii] == -1:
 121                ffnet_out[ii] = len(networks)-1
 122                
 123        # Assemble ffnetworks
 124        self.networks = networks
 125        self.ffnet_out = ffnet_out
 126
 127        # Set model_name if unspecified
 128        if model_name is None:
 129            self.model_name = self.model_string()
 130        else:
 131            self.model_name = model_name
 132
 133        # Assign optimizer params
 134        if optimizer_params is None:
 135            optimizer_params = create_optimizer_params()
 136        self.opt_params = optimizer_params
 137        self.speckled_flag = False
 138    # END NDN.__init__
 139
 140    def assemble_ffnetworks(self, ffnet_list, external_nets=None):
 141        """
 142        This function takes a list of ffnetworks and puts them together 
 143        in order. This has to do two steps for each ffnetwork: 
 144
 145        1. Plug in the inputs to each ffnetwork as specified
 146        2. Builds the ff-network with the input
 147        
 148        This returns the 'network', which is (currently) a module with a 
 149        'forward' and 'reg_loss' function specified.
 150
 151        When multiple ffnet inputs are concatenated, it will always happen in the first
 152        (filter) dimension, so all other dimensions must match
 153
 154        Args:
 155            ffnet_list (list): A list of ffnetworks to be assembled.
 156            external_nets (optional): External networks to be passed into the 'external' type ffnetworks.
 157
 158        Returns:
 159            networks (nn.ModuleList): A module list containing the assembled ff-networks.
 160
 161        Raises:
 162            AssertionError: If ffnet_list is not a list.
 163        """
 164
 165        assert type(ffnet_list) is list, "ffnet_list must be a list."
 166        
 167        num_networks = len(ffnet_list)
 168        # Make list of pytorch modules
 169        networks = nn.ModuleList()
 170
 171        for mm in range(num_networks):
 172
 173            # Determine internal network input to each subsequent network (if exists)
 174            if ffnet_list[mm]['ffnet_n'] is not None:
 175                nets_in = ffnet_list[mm]['ffnet_n']
 176                input_dims_list = []
 177                for ii in range(len(nets_in)):
 178                    assert nets_in[ii] < mm, "FFnet%d (%d): input networks must come earlier"%(mm, ii)
 179                    input_dims_list.append(networks[nets_in[ii]].output_dims)
 180                ffnet_list[mm]['input_dims_list'] = input_dims_list
 181        
 182            # Create corresponding FFnetwork
 183            net_type = ffnet_list[mm]['ffnet_type']
 184            if net_type == 'external':  # separate case because needs to pass in external modules directly
 185                networks.append( NDNnetworks.FFnet_external(ffnet_list[mm], external_nets))
 186            else:
 187                networks.append( FFnets[net_type](**ffnet_list[mm]) )
 188
 189        return networks
 190    # END NDNT.assemble_ffnetworks
 191
 192    def compute_network_outputs(self, Xs):
 193        """
 194        Computes the network outputs for the given input data.
 195
 196        Args:
 197            Xs (list): The input data.
 198
 199        Returns:
 200            tuple: A tuple containing the network inputs and network outputs.
 201
 202        Raises:
 203            AssertionError: If no networks are defined in this NDN.
 204
 205        Note:
 206            This method currently saves only the network outputs and does not return the network inputs.
 207        """
 208
 209        assert 'networks' in dir(self), "compute_network_outputs: No networks defined in this NDN"
 210
 211        net_ins, net_outs = [], []
 212        for ii in range(len(self.networks)):
 213            if self.networks[ii].ffnets_in is None:
 214                # then getting external input
 215                net_ins.append( [Xs[self.networks[ii].xstim_n]] )
 216                net_outs.append( self.networks[ii]( net_ins[-1] ) )
 217            else:
 218                in_nets = self.networks[ii].ffnets_in
 219                # Assemble network inputs in list, which will be used by FFnetwork
 220                inputs = []
 221                for mm in range(len(in_nets)):
 222                    inputs.append( net_outs[in_nets[mm]] )
 223                
 224                net_ins.append(inputs)
 225                net_outs.append( self.networks[ii](inputs) ) 
 226        return net_ins, net_outs
 227    # END NDNT.compute_network_outputs
 228
 229    def forward(self, Xs):
 230            """
 231            Applies the forward pass of each network in sequential order.
 232
 233            Args:
 234                Xs (list): List of input data.
 235
 236            Returns:
 237                ndarray: Output of the forward pass.
 238
 239            Notes:
 240                The tricky thing is concatenating multiple-input dimensions together correctly.
 241                Note that the external inputs are actually in principle a list of inputs.
 242            """
 243
 244            net_ins, net_outs = self.compute_network_outputs(Xs)
 245            # For now assume it's just one output, given by the first value of self.ffnet_out
 246            return net_outs[self.ffnet_out[0]]
 247    # END NDNT.forward
 248
 249    def training_step(self, batch, batch_idx=None):
 250        """
 251        Performs a single training step.
 252
 253        Args:
 254            batch (dict): A dictionary containing the input data batch.
 255            batch_idx (int, optional): The index of the current batch. Defaults to None.
 256
 257        Returns:
 258            dict: A dictionary containing the loss values for training, total loss, and regularization loss.
 259        """
 260
 261        y = batch['robs']
 262
 263        if self.speckled_flag:
 264            dfs = batch['dfs'] * batch['Mtrn']
 265        else:
 266            dfs = batch['dfs']
 267
 268        y_hat = self(batch)
 269
 270        loss = self.loss(y_hat, y, dfs)
 271
 272        regularizers = self.compute_reg_loss()
 273
 274        return {'loss': loss + regularizers, 'train_loss': loss, 'reg_loss': regularizers}
 275    # END Encoder.training_step
 276
 277    def validation_step(self, batch, batch_idx=None):
 278        """
 279        Performs a validation step for the model.
 280
 281        Args:
 282            batch (dict): A dictionary containing the input batch data.
 283            batch_idx (int, optional): The index of the current batch. Defaults to None.
 284
 285        Returns:
 286            dict: A dictionary containing the computed losses for the validation step.
 287        """
 288        
 289        y = batch['robs']
 290
 291        if self.speckled_flag:
 292            dfs = batch['dfs'] * batch['Mval']
 293        else:
 294            dfs = batch['dfs']
 295
 296        y_hat = self(batch)
 297        loss = self.val_loss(y_hat, y, dfs)
 298        
 299        reg_loss = self.compute_reg_loss()
 300        
 301        return {'loss': loss, 'val_loss': loss, 'reg_loss': reg_loss}
 302    
 303    def compute_reg_loss(self):
 304            """
 305            Computes the regularization loss for the NDNT model.
 306
 307            Args:
 308                None
 309
 310            Returns:
 311                The total regularization loss.
 312            """
 313
 314            rloss = []
 315            for network in self.networks:
 316                rloss.append(network.compute_reg_loss())
 317            return reduce(torch.add, rloss)
 318    
 319    def get_trainer(self,
 320        version=None,
 321        save_dir='./checkpoints',
 322        name='jnkname',
 323        optimizer=None,
 324        scheduler=None,
 325        device=None,
 326        optimizer_type='AdamW',
 327        early_stopping=False,
 328        early_stopping_patience=5,
 329        early_stopping_delta=0.0,
 330        optimize_graph=False,
 331        **kwargs):
 332        """
 333        Returns a trainer object.
 334
 335        Args:
 336            version (str): The version of the trainer.
 337            save_dir (str): The directory to save the trainer checkpoints.
 338            name (str): The name of the trainer.
 339            optimizer (torch.optim.Optimizer): The optimizer to use for training.
 340            scheduler (torch.optim.lr_scheduler._LRScheduler): The scheduler to use for adjusting the learning rate during training.
 341            device (str or torch.device): The device to use for training. If not specified, it will default to 'cuda:0' if available, otherwise 'cpu'.
 342            optimizer_type (str): The type of optimizer to use. Default is 'AdamW'.
 343            early_stopping (bool): Whether to use early stopping during training. Default is False.
 344            early_stopping_patience (int): The number of epochs to wait for improvement before stopping early. Default is 5.
 345            early_stopping_delta (float): The minimum change in the monitored metric to be considered as improvement. Default is 0.0.
 346            optimize_graph (bool): Whether to optimize the computation graph during training. Default is False.
 347            **kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to be passed to the trainer.
 348
 349        Returns:
 350            trainer (Trainer): The trainer object.
 351        """
 352
 353        from NDNT.training import Trainer, EarlyStopping, LBFGSTrainer
 354        import os
 355
 356        trainers = {'step': Trainer, 'lbfgs': LBFGSTrainer}
 357
 358        if optimizer is None:  # then specified through optimizer inputs
 359            optimizer = self.get_optimizer(optimizer_type=optimizer_type, **kwargs)
 360
 361        if early_stopping:
 362            earlystopper = EarlyStopping(patience=early_stopping_patience, delta=early_stopping_delta)
 363        else:
 364            earlystopper = None
 365
 366        if device is None:
 367            device = torch.device("cuda:0" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")
 368        else:
 369            if isinstance(device, str):
 370                device = torch.device(device)
 371            elif not isinstance(device, torch.device):
 372                raise ValueError("device must be a string or torch.device")
 373
 374        trainer_type = 'step'
 375        if optimizer is not None:
 376            if isinstance(optimizer, torch.optim.LBFGS):
 377                trainer_type = 'lbfgs'
 378        else:
 379            if optimizer_type == 'LBFGS':
 380                trainer_type = 'lbfgs'
 381
 382        trainer = trainers[trainer_type](model=self,
 383                                         optimizer=optimizer,
 384                                         early_stopping=earlystopper,
 385                                         dirpath=os.path.join(save_dir, name),
 386                                         optimize_graph=optimize_graph,
 387                                         device=device,
 388                                         scheduler=scheduler,
 389                                         version=version,
 390                                         **kwargs
 391                                         )
 392
 393        return trainer
 394
 395    def get_dataloaders(self,
 396            dataset,
 397            train_inds=None,
 398            val_inds=None,
 399            batch_size=10, 
 400            num_workers=0,
 401            #is_fixation=False,
 402            is_multiexp=False,
 403            full_batch=False,
 404            pin_memory=False,
 405            data_seed=None,
 406            #device=None,
 407            **kwargs):
 408        
 409        """
 410        Creates dataloaders for training and validation.
 411
 412        Args:
 413            dataset (Dataset): The dataset to use for training and validation.
 414            train_inds (list): The indices of the training data.
 415            val_inds (list): The indices of the validation data.
 416            batch_size (int): The batch size to use.
 417            num_workers (int): The number of workers to use for data loading.
 418            is_multiexp (bool): Whether the dataset is a multi-experiment dataset.
 419            full_batch (bool): Whether to use the full batch for training.
 420            pin_memory (bool): Whether to pin memory for faster data loading.
 421            data_seed (int): The seed to use for the data loader.
 422            **kwargs: Additional keyword arguments.
 423
 424        Returns:
 425            train_dl (DataLoader): The training data loader.
 426            valid_dl (DataLoader): The validation data loader.
 427        """
 428
 429        from torch.utils.data import DataLoader, random_split, Subset
 430
 431        # get the verbose flag if it is provided, default to False if not
 432        verbose = kwargs.get('verbose', False)
 433
 434        covariates = list(dataset[0].keys())
 435        #print('Dataset covariates:', covariates)
 436
 437        if train_inds is None or val_inds is None:
 438            n_val = len(dataset)//5
 439            n_train = len(dataset)-n_val
 440
 441            if data_seed is None:
 442                train_ds, val_ds = random_split(dataset, lengths=[n_train, n_val], generator=torch.Generator()) # .manual_seed(42)
 443            else:
 444                train_ds, val_ds = random_split(dataset, lengths=[n_train, n_val], generator=torch.Generator().manual_seed(data_seed))
 445        
 446            if train_inds is None:
 447                train_inds = train_ds.indices
 448            if val_inds is None:
 449                val_inds = val_ds.indices
 450            
 451        # build dataloaders:
 452        if self.block_sample:
 453            # New method: just change collate function to collate_blocks provided by dataset
 454            #train_ds = Subset(dataset, train_inds)
 455            #val_ds = Subset(dataset, val_inds)
 456
 457            #train_dl = DataLoader(
 458            #    train_ds, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=True, collate_fn=dataset.collate_blocks,
 459            #    num_workers=num_workers, pin_memory=pin_memory)
 460            #valid_dl = DataLoader(
 461            #    val_ds, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=True, collate_fn=dataset.collate_blocks,
 462            #    num_workers=num_workers, pin_memory=pin_memory)
 463
 464            # we use a batch sampler to sample the data because it generates indices for the whole batch at one time
 465            # instead of iterating over each sample. This is both faster (probably) for our cases, and it allows us
 466            # to use the "Fixation" datasets and concatenate along a variable-length batch dimension
 467            train_sampler = torch.utils.data.sampler.BatchSampler(
 468                torch.utils.data.sampler.SubsetRandomSampler(train_inds),
 469                batch_size=batch_size,
 470                drop_last=False)
 471            
 472            val_sampler = torch.utils.data.sampler.BatchSampler(
 473                torch.utils.data.sampler.SubsetRandomSampler(val_inds),
 474                batch_size=batch_size,
 475                drop_last=False)
 476
 477            train_dl = DataLoader(dataset, sampler=train_sampler, batch_size=None, num_workers=num_workers)
 478            valid_dl = DataLoader(dataset, sampler=val_sampler, batch_size=None, num_workers=num_workers)
 479        elif is_multiexp:
 480            train_sampler = ExperimentSampler(dataset, batch_size=batch_size, indices=train_inds, shuffle=True, verbose=verbose)
 481            val_sampler = ExperimentSampler(dataset, batch_size=batch_size, indices=val_inds, shuffle=True, verbose=verbose)
 482
 483            train_dl = DataLoader(dataset, sampler=train_sampler, batch_size=None, num_workers=num_workers)
 484            valid_dl = DataLoader(dataset, sampler=val_sampler, batch_size=None, num_workers=num_workers)
 485        else:
 486            train_ds = Subset(dataset, train_inds)
 487            val_ds = Subset(dataset, val_inds)
 488
 489            shuffle_data = True  # no reason not to shuffle -- samples everything over epoch
 490            if pin_memory:
 491                print('Pinning memory')
 492            train_dl = DataLoader(
 493                train_ds, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=shuffle_data,
 494                num_workers=num_workers, pin_memory=pin_memory)
 495            valid_dl = DataLoader(
 496                val_ds, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=shuffle_data,
 497                num_workers=num_workers, pin_memory=pin_memory)
 498            
 499        return train_dl, valid_dl
 500    # END NDN.get_dataloaders
 501
 502    def get_optimizer(self,
 503            optimizer_type='AdamW',
 504            learning_rate=0.001,
 505            weight_decay=0.01,
 506            amsgrad=False,
 507            betas=(0.9, 0.999),
 508            max_iter=10,
 509            history_size=4,
 510            tolerance_change=1e-3,
 511            tolerance_grad=1e-4,
 512            line_search_fn=None,
 513            **kwargs):
 514        
 515        """
 516        Returns an optimizer object.
 517
 518        Args:
 519            optimizer_type (str): The type of optimizer to use. Default is 'AdamW'.
 520            learning_rate (float): The learning rate to use. Default is 0.001.
 521            weight_decay (float): The weight decay to use. Default is 0.01.
 522            amsgrad (bool): Whether to use the AMSGrad variant of Adam. Default is False.
 523            betas (tuple): The beta values to use for the optimizer. Default is (0.9, 0.999).
 524            max_iter (int): The maximum number of iterations for the LBFGS optimizer. Default is 10.
 525            history_size (int): The history size to use for the LBFGS optimizer. Default is 4.
 526
 527        Returns:
 528            optimizer (torch.optim.Optimizer): The optimizer object.
 529        """
 530        
 531        # Assign optimizer
 532        if optimizer_type=='AdamW':
 533
 534            # weight decay only affects certain parameters
 535            decay = []
 536            
 537            decay_names = []
 538            no_decay_names = []
 539            no_decay = []
 540            for name, m in self.named_parameters():
 541                if 'weight' in name:
 542                    decay.append(m)
 543                    decay_names.append(name)
 544                else:
 545                    no_decay.append(m)
 546                    no_decay_names.append(name)
 547
 548            optimizer = torch.optim.AdamW([{'params': no_decay, 'weight_decay': 0}, {'params': decay, 'weight_decay': weight_decay}],
 549                    lr=learning_rate,
 550                    betas=betas,
 551                    amsgrad=amsgrad)
 552
 553        elif optimizer_type=='Adam':
 554            optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(self.parameters(),
 555                    lr=learning_rate,
 556                    betas=betas)
 557
 558        elif optimizer_type=='LBFGS':
 559
 560            optimizer = torch.optim.LBFGS(
 561                self.parameters(), 
 562                history_size=history_size, max_iter=max_iter, 
 563                tolerance_change=tolerance_change,
 564                tolerance_grad=tolerance_grad,
 565                line_search_fn=line_search_fn)
 566
 567        else:
 568            raise ValueError('optimizer [%s] not supported' %optimizer_type)
 569        
 570        return optimizer
 571    # END NDN.get_optimizer
 572    
 573    def prepare_regularization(self):
 574        """
 575        Prepares the regularization for the model.
 576
 577        Returns:
 578            None
 579        """
 580
 581        for network in self.networks:
 582            network.prepare_regularization(device=self.device)
 583
 584    def fit(self,
 585        dataset,
 586        train_inds=None,
 587        val_inds=None,
 588        speckledXV=False,
 589        seed=None, # this currently seed for data AND optimization
 590        save_dir:str=None,
 591        version:int=None,
 592        #name:str=None,
 593        optimizer=None,  # this can pass in full optimizer (rather than keyword)
 594        scheduler=None,
 595        batch_size=None,
 596        force_dict_training=False,  # will force dict-based training instead of using data-loaders for LBFGS
 597        block_sample=None, # to pass in flag to use dataset's block-sampler (and choose appropriate dataloader)
 598        reuse_trainer=False,
 599        device=None,
 600        **kwargs  # kwargs replaces explicit opt_params, which can list some or all of the following
 601        ):
 602
 603        """
 604        Trains the model using the specified dataset.
 605
 606        Args:
 607            dataset (Dataset): The dataset to use for training and validation.
 608            train_inds (list): The indices of the training data.
 609            val_inds (list): The indices of the validation data.
 610            speckledXV (bool): Whether to use speckled cross-validation. Default is False.
 611            seed (int): The seed to use for reproducibility.
 612            save_dir (str): The directory to save the model checkpoints.
 613            version (int): The version of the trainer.
 614            optimizer (torch.optim.Optimizer): The optimizer to use for training.
 615            scheduler (torch.optim.lr_scheduler._LRScheduler): The scheduler to use for adjusting the learning rate during training.
 616            batch_size (int): The batch size to use.
 617            force_dict_training (bool): Whether to force dictionary-based training. Default is False.
 618            block_sample (bool): Whether to use block sampling. Default is None.
 619            reuse_trainer (bool): Whether to reuse the trainer. Default is False.
 620            device (str or torch.device): The device to use for training. Default is None.
 621            **kwargs: Additional keyword arguments.
 622
 623        Returns:
 624            None
 625
 626        Raises:
 627            AssertionError: If batch_size is not specified.
 628
 629        Notes:
 630            The fit method is the main training loop for the model.
 631            Steps:
 632            1. Get a trainer and dataloaders
 633            2. Prepare regularizers
 634            3. Run the main fit loop from the trainer, checkpoint, and save model
 635        """
 636
 637        import time
 638
 639        assert batch_size is not None, "NDN.fit() must be passed batch_size in optimization params."
 640
 641        if save_dir is None:
 642            save_dir = self.working_dir
 643
 644        if block_sample is not None:
 645            self.block_sample = block_sample
 646
 647        # Should be set ahead of time
 648        name = self.model_name
 649
 650        # Determine train_inds and val_inds: read from dataset if not specified, or warn
 651        self.speckled_flag = speckledXV  # This determines training/test loop
 652        if speckledXV:
 653            assert train_inds is None, "SPECKLED: no train_inds"
 654            assert val_inds is None, "SPECKLED: no val_inds"
 655            train_inds = range(len(dataset))
 656            val_inds = range(len(dataset))
 657        else:
 658            if train_inds is None:
 659                # check dataset itself
 660                if self.block_sample:
 661                    if hasattr(dataset, 'train_blks'):
 662                        if dataset.train_blks is not None:
 663                            train_inds = dataset.train_blks
 664                        else:
 665                            print( "Warning: no train_bkls specified in dataset (block_sample)")
 666                    else:
 667                        print( "Warning: no train_bkls specified (block_sample)")                
 668                else:
 669                    if hasattr(dataset, 'train_inds'):
 670                        if dataset.train_inds is not None:
 671                            train_inds = dataset.train_inds
 672                        else:
 673                            print( "Warning: no train_inds specified in dataset" )
 674                    else:
 675                        train_inds = range(len(dataset))
 676                        if 'verbose' in kwargs.keys():
 677                            if kwargs['verbose'] > 0:
 678                                print( "Warning: no train_inds specified. Using full dataset passed in.")
 679            if val_inds is None:
 680                if self.block_sample:
 681                    if hasattr(dataset, 'val_blks'):
 682                        if dataset.val_inds is not None:
 683                            val_inds = dataset.val_blks
 684                        else:
 685                            print( "Warning: no val_bkls specified in dataset (block_sample)")
 686                    else:
 687                        print( "Warning: no val_bkls specified (block_sample)")
 688                else:
 689                    if hasattr(dataset, 'val_inds'):
 690                        if dataset.val_inds is not None:
 691                            val_inds = dataset.val_inds
 692                        else:
 693                            print( "Warning: no val_inds specified in dataset." )
 694                    else:
 695                        print( "No val_inds specified.")
 696
 697        if force_dict_training:
 698            batch_size = len(train_inds)
 699
 700        # Check to see if loss-flags require any initialization using dataset information 
 701        if self.loss_module.unit_weighting or (self.loss_module.batch_weighting == 2):
 702            self.initialize_loss(dataset, batch_size=batch_size, data_inds=train_inds) 
 703
 704        # Prepare model regularization (will build reg_modules)
 705        self.prepare_regularization()
 706
 707        if 'verbose' in kwargs:
 708            if kwargs['verbose'] > 0:
 709                print( 'Model:', self.model_name)
 710
 711        # Make trainer 
 712        if reuse_trainer & (self.trainer is not None):
 713            trainer = self.trainer
 714            print("  Reusing existing trainer")
 715        else:
 716            trainer = self.get_trainer(
 717                version=version,
 718                optimizer=optimizer,
 719                scheduler=scheduler,
 720                save_dir=save_dir,
 721                name=name,
 722                device=device,
 723                **kwargs)
 724
 725        t0 = time.time()
 726        if force_dict_training:
 727            from NDNT.training import LBFGSTrainer
 728            assert isinstance(trainer, LBFGSTrainer), "force_dict_training will not work unless using LBFGS." 
 729
 730            #trainer.fit(self, train_dl.dataset[:], valid_dl.dataset[:], seed=seed)
 731            trainer.fit(self, dataset[train_inds], dataset[val_inds], seed=seed)
 732        else:
 733            # Create dataloaders / 
 734            train_dl, valid_dl = self.get_dataloaders(
 735                dataset, batch_size=batch_size, 
 736                train_inds=train_inds, val_inds=val_inds, data_seed=seed, **kwargs)
 737    
 738            trainer.fit(self, train_dl, valid_dl, seed=seed)
 739        t1 = time.time()
 740
 741        self.trainer = trainer
 742
 743        if 'verbose' in kwargs.keys():
 744            if kwargs['verbose'] > 0:
 745                print('  Fit complete:', t1-t0, 'sec elapsed')
 746        else:  # default behavior
 747            print('  Fit complete:', t1-t0, 'sec elapsed')
 748    # END NDN.fit
 749
 750    def fit_dl(self,
 751        train_ds, val_ds, 
 752        seed=None,
 753        save_dir:str=None,
 754        version:int=None,
 755        name:str=None,
 756        optimizer=None,
 757        scheduler=None,
 758        batch_size=None,
 759        num_workers=0,
 760        force_dict_training=False,
 761        device=None,
 762        **kwargs):
 763        """
 764        Fits the model using deep learning training.
 765
 766        Args:
 767            train_ds (Dataset): The training dataset.
 768            val_ds (Dataset): The validation dataset.
 769            seed (int, optional): The seed for data and optimization. Defaults to None.
 770            save_dir (str, optional): The directory to save the model. Defaults to None.
 771            version (int, optional): The version of the model. Defaults to None.
 772            name (str, optional): The name of the model. Defaults to None.
 773            optimizer (Optimizer, optional): The optimizer for training. Defaults to None.
 774            scheduler (Scheduler, optional): The scheduler for training. Defaults to None.
 775            batch_size (int, optional): The batch size for training. Defaults to None.
 776            num_workers (int, optional): The number of workers for data loading. Defaults to 0.
 777            force_dict_training (bool, optional): Whether to force dictionary-based training instead of using data loaders for LBFGS. Defaults to False.
 778            device (str, optional): The device to use for training. Defaults to None.
 779            **kwargs: Additional keyword arguments.
 780
 781        Returns:
 782            None
 783
 784        Raises:
 785            AssertionError: If batch_size is not provided.
 786
 787        Notes:
 788            This is the main training loop.
 789            Steps:
 790            1. Get a trainer and data loaders.
 791            2. Prepare regularizers.
 792            3. Run the main fit loop from the trainer, checkpoint, and save the model.
 793        """
 794    
 795        import time
 796
 797        assert batch_size is not None, "NDN.fit() must be passed batch_size in optimization params."
 798
 799        if save_dir is None:
 800            save_dir = self.working_dir
 801        
 802        if name is None:
 803            name = self.model_name
 804
 805        # Check to see if loss-flags require any initialization using dataset information 
 806        if self.loss_module.unit_weighting or (self.loss_module.batch_weighting == 2):
 807            if force_dict_training:
 808                batch_size = len(train_ds)
 809            self.initialize_loss(train_ds, batch_size=batch_size) 
 810
 811        # Prepare model regularization (will build reg_modules)
 812        self.prepare_regularization()
 813
 814        # Create dataloaders 
 815        shuffle_data=True  # no condition when we don't want it shuffled, right?
 816
 817        from torch.utils.data import DataLoader
 818        train_dl = DataLoader( train_ds, batch_size=batch_size, num_workers=num_workers, shuffle=shuffle_data) 
 819        valid_dl = DataLoader( val_ds, batch_size=batch_size, num_workers=num_workers, shuffle=shuffle_data) 
 820
 821        # Make trainer
 822        trainer = self.get_trainer(
 823            version=version,
 824            optimizer=optimizer,
 825            scheduler=scheduler,
 826            save_dir=save_dir,
 827            name=name,
 828            device=device,
 829            **kwargs)
 830
 831        t0 = time.time()
 832        if force_dict_training:
 833            from NDNT.training import LBFGSTrainer
 834            assert isinstance(trainer, LBFGSTrainer), "force_dict_training will not work unless using LBFGS." 
 835
 836            trainer.fit(self, train_dl.dataset[:], valid_dl.dataset[:], seed=seed)
 837        else:
 838            trainer.fit(self, train_dl, valid_dl, seed=seed)
 839        t1 = time.time()
 840
 841        if 'verbose' in kwargs.keys():
 842            if kwargs['verbose'] > 0:
 843                print('  Fit complete:', t1-t0, 'sec elapsed')
 844        else:  # default behavior
 845            print('  Fit complete:', t1-t0, 'sec elapsed')
 846        self.trainer = trainer
 847    # END NDN.fit_dl
 848    
 849    def initialize_loss(self, dataset=None, batch_size=None, data_inds=None, batch_weighting=None, unit_weighting=None):
 850        """
 851        Interacts with loss_module to set loss flags and/or pass in dataset information.
 852        
 853        Args:
 854            dataset (optional): The dataset to be used for computing average batch size and unit weights.
 855            batch_size (optional): The batch size to be used for computing average batch size.
 856            data_inds (optional): The indices of the data in the dataset to be used.
 857            batch_weighting (optional): The batch weighting value to be set. Must be one of [-1, 0, 1, 2].
 858            unit_weighting (optional): The unit weighting value to be set.
 859        
 860        Returns:
 861            None
 862
 863        Notes:
 864            Without a dataset, this method will only set the flags 'batch_weighting' and 'unit_weighting'.
 865            With a dataset, this method will set 'av_batch_size' and 'unit_weights' based on the average rate.
 866        """
 867
 868        if batch_weighting is None:
 869            batch_weighting = self.loss_module.batch_weighting
 870        else:
 871            assert batch_weighting in [0,1,2,-1], "Initialize loss: invalid batch_weighting value: %d"%batch_weighting
 872        if unit_weighting is None:
 873            unit_weighting = self.loss_module.unit_weighting
 874        
 875        unit_weights, av_batch_size = None, None
 876        if dataset is not None:
 877            assert batch_size is not None, "Initialize loss: need to have batch_size defined with dataset"
 878            if data_inds is None:
 879                data_inds = range(len(dataset))
 880
 881            # Compute average batch size
 882            T = len(data_inds)
 883            num_batches = np.ceil(T/batch_size)
 884            av_batch_size = T/num_batches
 885
 886            # Compute unit weights based on number of spikes in dataset (and/or firing rate) if requested
 887            unit_weights = 1.0/np.maximum( self.compute_average_responses(dataset, data_inds=data_inds), 1e-8 )
 888
 889        self.loss_module.set_loss_weighting( 
 890            batch_weighting=batch_weighting, unit_weighting=unit_weighting, 
 891            unit_weights=unit_weights, av_batch_size=av_batch_size )
 892    # END NDNT.initialize_loss
 893
 894    def compute_average_responses( self, dataset, data_inds=None ):
 895        """
 896        Computes the average responses for the specified dataset.
 897
 898        Args:
 899            dataset: The dataset to use for computing the average responses.
 900            data_inds: The indices of the data in the dataset.
 901
 902        Returns:
 903            ndarray: The average responses.
 904        """
 905
 906        if data_inds is None:
 907            data_inds = range(len(dataset))
 908        
 909        # Check if dataset has specified function
 910        if hasattr( dataset, 'avrates' ):
 911            return dataset.avrates()
 912
 913        # Iterate through dataset to compute average rates
 914        NC = dataset[0]['robs'].shape[-1]
 915        Rsum, Tsum = torch.zeros(NC), torch.zeros(NC)
 916        for tt in data_inds:
 917            sample = dataset[tt]
 918            if len(sample['robs'].shape) == 1:  # then one datapoint at a time
 919                Tsum += sample['dfs'].cpu()
 920                Rsum += torch.mul(sample['dfs'], sample['robs']).cpu()
 921            else: # then each sample contains multiple datapoints and need to sum
 922                Tsum += torch.sum(sample['dfs'], axis=0).cpu()
 923                Rsum += torch.sum(torch.mul(sample['dfs'], sample['robs']), axis=0).cpu()
 924
 925        return torch.divide( Rsum, Tsum.clamp(1) ).cpu().detach().numpy()
 926    # END NDNT.compute_average_responses
 927
 928    def initialize_biases( self, dataset, data_inds=None, ffnet_target=-1, layer_target=-1 ):
 929        """
 930        Initializes the biases for the specified dataset.
 931
 932        Args:
 933            dataset: The dataset to use for initializing the biases.
 934            data_inds: The indices of the data in the dataset.
 935            ffnet_target: The target feedforward network.
 936            layer_target: The target layer.
 937
 938        Returns:
 939            None
 940
 941        Notes:
 942            This method initializes the biases for the specified feedforward network and layer using the average responses.
 943        """
 944
 945        avRs = self.compute_average_responses( dataset=dataset, data_inds=data_inds )
 946        # Invert last layer nonlinearity
 947        assert len(avRs) == len(self.networks[ffnet_target].layers[layer_target].bias), "Need to specify output NL correctly: layer confusion."
 948        if self.networks[ffnet_target].layers[layer_target].NL is None:
 949            print( 'Initializing biases given linear NL')
 950            biases = avRs
 951            
 952        elif isinstance(self.networks[ffnet_target].layers[layer_target].NL, nn.Softplus):
 953            print( 'Initializing biases given Softplus NL')
 954            # Invert softplus
 955            beta = self.networks[ffnet_target].layers[layer_target].NL.beta
 956            biases = np.log(np.exp(np.maximum(avRs, 1e-6))-1)/beta
 957        else:
 958            biases = np.zeros(len(avRs))
 959        
 960        self.networks[ffnet_target].layers[layer_target].bias.data = torch.tensor(biases, dtype=torch.float32)
 961    # otherwise not initializing biases, even if desired
 962
 963    def eval_models(
 964        self, data, data_inds=None, bits=False, null_adjusted=False, speckledXV=False, train_val=1,
 965        batch_size=1000, num_workers=0, device=None, **kwargs ):
 966        '''
 967        Evaluate the neural network models on the given data.
 968
 969        Args:
 970            data (dict or Dataset): The input data to evaluate the models on. If a dictionary is provided, it is assumed to be a single sample. If a Dataset object is provided, it is assumed to contain multiple samples.
 971            data_inds (list, optional): The indices of the data samples to evaluate. Only applicable if `data` is a Dataset object. Defaults to None.
 972            bits (bool, optional): If True, the result will be returned in units of bits/spike. Defaults to False.
 973            null_adjusted (bool, optional): If True, the null-adjusted log likelihood will be calculated. Defaults to False.
 974            speckledXV (bool, optional): If True, speckled cross-validation will be used. Defaults to False.
 975            train_val (int, optional): The train/validation split ratio. Only applicable if `speckledXV` is True. Defaults to 1.
 976            batch_size (int, optional): The batch size for data loading. Defaults to 1000.
 977            num_workers (int, optional): The number of worker processes for data loading. Defaults to 0.
 978            device (torch.device, optional): The device to perform the evaluation on. If None, the device of the model will be used. Defaults to None.
 979            **kwargs: Additional keyword arguments.
 980
 981        Returns:
 982            numpy.ndarray: The evaluated log likelihood values for each neuron.
 983
 984        Note:
 985            If `data` is a dictionary, it is assumed to contain the following keys:
 986                'robs': The observed responses.
 987                'Mval': The validation mask.
 988                'dfs': The data filters.
 989            If `data` is a Dataset object, it is assumed to have the following attributes:
 990                'robs': The observed responses.
 991                'dfs': The data filters.
 992
 993        Raises:
 994            AssertionError: If `data_inds` is not None when `data` is a dictionary.
 995        '''
 996
 997        # Switch into evaluation mode
 998        self.eval()
 999
1000        if isinstance(data, dict): 
1001            # Then assume that this is just to evaluate a sample: keep original here
1002            assert data_inds is None, "Cannot use data_inds if passing in a dataset sample."
1003            dev0 = data['robs'].device
1004            if device is not None:
1005                if device != dev0:
1006                    "For dictionary-based evaluation, constrained to the device the data is on."
1007
1008            m0 = self.to(dev0)
1009            yhat = m0(data)
1010            y = data['robs']
1011            if speckledXV:
1012                if train_val == 1:
1013                    dfs = data['Mval']*data['dfs']
1014                else:
1015                    dfs = data['Mtrn']*data['dfs']
1016            else:
1017                dfs = data['dfs']
1018            
1019            if 'poisson' in m0.loss_type:
1020                loss = m0.loss_module.lossNR
1021            else:
1022                print("This loss-type is not supported for eval_models.")
1023                loss = None
1024
1025            with torch.no_grad():
1026                LLraw = torch.sum( 
1027                    torch.multiply( 
1028                        dfs, 
1029                        loss(yhat, y)),
1030                        axis=0).detach().cpu().numpy()
1031                obscnt = torch.sum(
1032                    torch.multiply(dfs, y), axis=0).detach().cpu().numpy()
1033                
1034                Ts = np.maximum(torch.sum(dfs, axis=0).detach().cpu().numpy(), 1)
1035
1036                LLneuron = LLraw / np.maximum(obscnt,1) # note making positive
1037
1038                if null_adjusted:
1039                    #predcnt = torch.sum(
1040                    #    torch.multiply(dfs, yhat), axis=0).detach().cpu().numpy()
1041                    #rbar = np.divide(predcnt, Ts)
1042                    #LLnulls = np.log(rbar)-np.divide(predcnt, np.maximum(obscnt,1))
1043                    rbar = np.divide(obscnt, np.maximum(Ts, 1))
1044                    LLnulls = np.log(np.maximum(rbar, 1e-6))-1
1045
1046                    LLneuron = -LLneuron - LLnulls             
1047
1048            return LLneuron  # end of the old method
1049
1050        else:
1051            # This will be the 'modern' eval_models using already-defined self.loss_module
1052            # In this case, assume data is dataset
1053            if data_inds is None:
1054                data_inds = list(range(len(data)))
1055
1056            from torch.utils.data import DataLoader, Subset
1057
1058            data_dl, _ = self.get_dataloaders(
1059                data, batch_size=batch_size, num_workers=num_workers, 
1060                train_inds=data_inds, val_inds=data_inds)
1061            #data_ds = Subset(data, data_inds)
1062            #data_dl = DataLoader(data_ds, batch_size=batch_size, num_workers=num_workers)
1063
1064            LLsum, Tsum, Rsum = 0, 0, 0
1065            from tqdm import tqdm
1066            d0 = next(self.parameters()).device  # device the model is currently on
1067            self = self.to(device)
1068
1069            for data_sample in tqdm(data_dl, desc='Eval models'):
1070                # data_sample = data[tt]
1071                for dsub in data_sample.keys():
1072                    if data_sample[dsub].device != device:
1073                        data_sample[dsub] = data_sample[dsub].to(device)
1074                with torch.no_grad():
1075                    pred = self(data_sample)
1076                    if speckledXV:
1077                        if train_val == 1:
1078                            dfs = data_sample['dfs']*data_sample['Mval']
1079                        else:
1080                            dfs = data_sample['dfs']*data_sample['Mtrn']
1081                    else:
1082                        dfs = data_sample['dfs']
1083                    
1084                    LLsum += self.loss_module.unit_loss( 
1085                        pred, data_sample['robs'], data_filters=dfs, temporal_normalize=False)
1086                    Tsum += torch.sum(data_sample['dfs'], axis=0)
1087                    Rsum += torch.sum(torch.mul(dfs, data_sample['robs']), axis=0)
1088            LLneuron = torch.divide(LLsum, Rsum.clamp(1) )
1089
1090            # Null-adjust
1091            if null_adjusted:
1092                rbar = torch.divide(Rsum, Tsum.clamp(1))
1093                LLnulls = torch.log(rbar)-1
1094                LLneuron = -LLneuron - LLnulls 
1095        if bits:
1096            LLneuron/=np.log(2)
1097
1098        self = self.to(d0)  # put back on original device
1099
1100        return LLneuron.detach().cpu().numpy()
1101
1102    def generate_predictions(self, data, data_inds=None, block_inds=None, batch_size=None, num_lags=0, ffnet_target=None, device=None):
1103        """
1104        Generate predictions for a dataset.
1105
1106        Args:
1107            data: The dataset.
1108            data_inds: The indices to use from the dataset.
1109            block_inds: The blocks to use from the dataset (if block_sample).
1110            batch_size: The batch size to use for processing. Reduce if running out of memory.
1111            num_lags: The number of lags to use for prediction.
1112            ffnet_target: The index of the feedforward network to use for prediction. Defaults to None.
1113            device: The device to use for prediction.
1114
1115        Returns:
1116            torch.Tensor: The predictions array.
1117        """
1118        
1119        # Switch into evalulation mode
1120        self.eval()
1121    
1122        # handle the block_sample case separately
1123        num_cells = self.networks[-1].output_dims[0]
1124    
1125        if self.block_sample:
1126            if device is not None:
1127                self.to(device)
1128
1129            assert data_inds is None, "block_sample currently does not handle data_inds"
1130            if batch_size is None:
1131                batch_size = 10   # default batch size for block_sample
1132            if block_inds is None:
1133                block_inds = np.arange(len(data.block_inds))
1134            
1135            total = len(block_inds)
1136            data_subset_NT = np.sum([len(data.block_inds[ii]) for ii in block_inds])
1137            pred = torch.zeros((data_subset_NT, num_cells)).to(device)
1138            with torch.no_grad():
1139                for i in tqdm.tqdm(range(0, total, batch_size)):
1140                    batch_block_inds = [data.block_inds[ii] for ii in block_inds[i:i+batch_size]]
1141                    batch_block_inds = np.concatenate(batch_block_inds)
1142                    data_batch = data[i:i+batch_size]
1143                    if device is not None:
1144                        for key in data_batch.keys():
1145                            data_batch[key] = data_batch[key].to(device)
1146                    if ffnet_target is not None:
1147                        pred_batch = self.networks[ffnet_target](data_batch)
1148                    else:
1149                        pred_batch = self(data_batch)
1150                    pred[batch_block_inds] = pred_batch
1151            return pred
1152    
1153    
1154        if isinstance(data, dict):
1155            # Then assume that this is just to evaluate a sample: keep original here
1156            assert data_inds is None, "Cannot use data_inds if passing in a dataset sample."
1157            dev0 = data['robs'].device
1158            m0 = self.to(dev0)
1159            with torch.no_grad():
1160                if ffnet_target is not None:
1161                    pred = m0.networks[ffnet_target](data)
1162                else:
1163                    pred = m0(data)
1164    
1165        else:
1166            if batch_size is None:
1167                batch_size = 2000   # default batch size for non-block_sample
1168            dev0 = data[0]['robs'].device
1169            m0 = self.to(dev0)
1170    
1171            if data_inds is None:
1172                data_inds = np.arange(len(data))
1173            NT = len(data_inds)
1174    
1175            pred = torch.zeros([NT, num_cells])
1176    
1177            # Must do contiguous sampling despite num_lags
1178            nblks = np.ceil(NT/batch_size).astype(int)
1179            for bb in tqdm.tqdm(range(nblks)):
1180                trange = np.arange(batch_size*bb-num_lags, batch_size*(bb+1))
1181                trange = trange[trange < NT]
1182                with torch.no_grad():
1183                    if ffnet_target is not None:
1184                        pred_tmp = m0.networks[ffnet_target](data[data_inds[trange]])
1185                    else:
1186                        pred_tmp = m0(data[data_inds[trange]])
1187                pred[batch_size*bb + np.arange(len(trange)-num_lags), :] = pred_tmp[num_lags:, :]
1188    
1189        return pred.cpu()
1190
1191    def change_loss( self, new_loss_type, dataset=None ):
1192        """
1193        Change the loss function for the model.
1194
1195        Args:
1196            new_loss_type: The new loss type.
1197            dataset: The dataset to use for initializing the loss.
1198
1199        Returns:
1200            None
1201
1202        Notes:
1203            This method swaps in a new loss module for the model.
1204            If a dataset is provided, the loss will be initialized during the fit.
1205        """
1206
1207        if isinstance(new_loss_type, str):
1208            self.loss_type = new_loss_type
1209            if self.loss_type == 'poisson' or self.loss_type == 'poissonT':
1210                self.loss_module = plosses.PoissonLoss_datafilter()  # defined below, but could be in own Losses.py
1211            elif self.loss_type in ['simple', 'poissonS']:
1212                self.loss_module = plosses.SimplePoissonLoss()
1213            elif self.loss_type in ['gaussian', 'mse']:
1214                self.loss_module = glosses.MseLoss_datafilter()
1215            else:
1216                print('Invalid loss function.')
1217                self.loss_module = None
1218        else: # assume passed in loss function directly
1219            self.loss_type = 'custom'
1220            self.loss_module = new_loss_type
1221
1222        # module can also be called as a function (since it has a forward)
1223        self.loss = self.loss_module
1224        self.val_loss = self.loss_module
1225
1226        if dataset is not None:
1227            if self.loss_module.unit_weighting or (self.loss_module.batch_weighting == 2):
1228                if dataset.trial_sample:
1229                    inds = dataset.train_blks
1230                else:
1231                    inds = dataset.train_inds
1232                self.initialize_loss(dataset, batch_size=self.batch_size, data_inds=inds) 
1233    # END change_loss()

1368    def save_model_zip(self, 
1369                       filename,
1370                       ffnet_list=None,
1371                       ffnet_out=None,
1372                       loss_type='poisson',
1373                       model_name=None,
1374                       working_dir='./checkpoints'):
1375        """
1376        Save the model as a zip file containing a json file with the model parameters
1377        and a .ckpt file with the state_dict.
1378
1379        Args:
1380            filename: The name of the zip file to save.
1381            ffnet_list: The list of feedforward networks.
1382            ffnet_out: The output layer of the feedforward network.
1383            loss_type: The loss type.
1384            model_name: The name of the model.
1385            working_dir: The working directory.
1386
1387        Returns:
1388            None
1389        """
1390
1391        if filename.endswith('.zip'):
1392            filename = filename[:-4]
1393
1394        # package params
1395        if ffnet_list is None:
1396            ndn_params = {'ffnet_list': self.ffnet_list, 
1397                          'loss_type':self.loss_type,
1398                          'ffnet_out': self.ffnet_out,
1399                          'model_name': self.model_name,
1400                          'working_dir': self.working_dir}
1401        else:
1402            ndn_params = {'ffnet_list': ffnet_list, 
1403                          'loss_type':loss_type,
1404                          'ffnet_out': ffnet_out,
1405                          'model_name': model_name,
1406                          'working_dir': working_dir}
1407
1408        # make zip_filename and ckpt_filename in the same directory as the filename
1409        json_filename = filename + '.json'
1410        ckpt_filename = filename + '.ckpt'
1411        with open(json_filename, 'w') as f:
1412            json.dump(ndn_params, f, cls=NpEncoder)
1413        torch.save(self.state_dict(), ckpt_filename)
1414        # zip up the two files
1415        with zipfile.ZipFile(filename + '.zip', 'w') as myzip:
1416            myzip.write(json_filename)
1417            myzip.write(ckpt_filename)
1418        # remove the two files
1419        os.remove(json_filename)
1420        os.remove(ckpt_filename)
1421
1422    @classmethod
1423    def load_model_zip(cls, filename):
1424        """
1425        Load the model from a zip file containing a json file with the model parameters
1426        and a .ckpt file with the state_dict.
1427
1428        Args:
1429            filename: The name of the zip file to load.
1430
1431        Returns:
1432            NDN: The loaded model.
1433        """
1434
1435        if filename.endswith('.zip'):
1436            filename = filename[:-4]
1437        # open the zip file
1438        with zipfile.ZipFile(filename + '.zip', 'r') as myzip:
1439            myzip.extractall()
1440        with open(filename + '.json', 'r') as f:
1441            params = json.load(f)
1442        ffnet_list = params['ffnet_list']
1443        loss_type = params['loss_type']
1444        ffnet_out = params['ffnet_out']
1445        model_name = params['model_name']
1446        working_dir = params['working_dir']
1447        # make an NDN object with the ffnet_list
1448        model = cls(ffnet_list=ffnet_list, 
1449                    loss_type=loss_type,
1450                    ffnet_out=ffnet_out,
1451                    model_name=model_name,
1452                    working_dir=working_dir)
1453        model.prepare_regularization() # this will build the reg_modules
1454        # load the state_dict
1455        state_dict = torch.load(filename + '.ckpt')
1456        model.load_state_dict(state_dict)
1457        # remove the two files
1458        os.remove(filename + '.json')
1459        os.remove(filename + '.ckpt')
1460        return model

1462    def save_model(self, filename=None, pt=False ):
1463        """
1464        Models will be saved using dill/pickle in as the filename, which can contain
1465        the directory information. Will be put in the CPU first
1466        
1467        Args:
1468            filename: The name of the file to save.
1469            pt: Whether to use torch.save instead of dill.
1470
1471        Returns:
1472            None
1473        """
1474
1475        import dill
1476        if filename is None:
1477            fn += self.model_name + '.pkl'
1478        else:
1479            fn = filename
1480
1481        # Eliminate nested objects
1482        if self.trainer is not None:
1483            del self.trainer
1484            self.trainer = None
1485
1486        print( '  Saving model at', fn)
1487
1488        with open(fn, 'wb') as f:
1489            if pt:
1490                torch.save(self.to(torch.device('cpu')), f)
1491            else:
1492                dill.dump(self.to(torch.device('cpu')), f)

1517        else :

1520

1524    def get_null_adjusted_ll(self, sample, bits=False):
1525        """
1526        Get the null-adjusted log likelihood.
1527
1528        Args:
1529            sample: The sample data from a dataset.
1530            bits: Whether to return the result in units of bits/spike.
1531
1532        Returns:
1533            float: The null-adjusted log likelihood.
1534        """
1535
1536        m0 = self.cpu()
1537        if self.loss_type == 'poisson':
1538            #loss = nn.PoissonNLLLoss(log_input=False, reduction='none')
1539            loss = self.loss_module.lossNR
1540        else:
1541            print('Whatever loss function you want is not yet here.')
1542        
1543        lnull = -loss(torch.ones(sample['robs'].shape)*sample['robs'].mean(axis=0), sample['robs']).detach().cpu().numpy().sum(axis=0)
1544        #yhat = m0(sample['stim'], shifter=sample['eyepos'])
1545        yhat = m0(sample)
1546        llneuron = -loss(yhat,sample['robs']).detach().cpu().numpy().sum(axis=0)
1547        rbar = sample['robs'].sum(axis=0).numpy()
1548        ll = (llneuron - lnull)/rbar
1549        if bits:
1550            ll/=np.log(2)
1551        return ll

1553    def get_activations(self, sample, ffnet_target=0, layer_target=0, NL=False):
1554        """
1555        Returns the inputs and outputs of a specified ffnet and layer
1556        
1557        Args:
1558            sample: dictionary of sample data from a dataset
1559            ffnet_target: which network to target (default: 0)
1560            layer_target: which layer to target (default: 0)
1561            NL: get activations using the nonlinearity as the module target
1562
1563        Returns:
1564            activations dict
1565            with keys:
1566                'input' : input to layer
1567                'output' : output of layer
1568        """
1569        
1570        activations = {}
1571
1572        def hook_fn(m, i, o):
1573            activations['input'] = i
1574            activations['output'] = o
1575
1576        if NL:
1577            if self.networks[ffnet_target].layers[layer_target].NL:
1578                handle = self.networks[ffnet_target].layers[layer_target].NL.register_forward_hook(hook_fn)
1579            else:
1580                raise ValueError('This layer does not have a non-linearity. Call with NL=False')
1581        else:
1582            handle = self.networks[ffnet_target].layers[layer_target].register_forward_hook(hook_fn)
1583
1584        out = self(sample)
1585        handle.remove()
1586        return activations
